Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: BIT INTERVAL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identification number for eachinterval in which a bit is used in the wellbore.
Column Comment.4: DRILL BIT PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: This PK component allows a drill bitinterval record to be associated with the same period more than once, in the eventthat the rour report contains more than one set of detailed information records.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: AVERAGE FORCE ON BIT: Weight or force of the drill string that is loaded on the bit,rather than suspended from the derrick.
Column Comment.8: AVERAGE PENETRATION RATE: Penetration rate for bit run in a period. Calculatedby dividing distance drilled by total hours run in the period.
Column Comment.9: AVERAGE PENETRATION RATE ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit ofmeasure of the average penetration bit.
Column Comment.10: AVERAGE ROTARY RPM: Rotations per minute of the drill bit. Usually refers torotary table, but could also refer to top drive, or mud motor rpm (inferred). Unitless.
Column Comment.11: BASE DEPTH: the base depth that the bit was drilling at during this interval.
Column Comment.13: BIT OPERATING TIME: The bit operating interval time which defines the total timethe drilling bit was operating for the bit run during a period.
Column Comment.14: BIT OPERATING TIME ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure ofthe bit operating time.
Column Comment.15: DRILL OPERATION TYPE: The kind of operation that the drilling bit is doing duringthis period, such as drilling, coring or reaming.
Column Comment.16: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.17: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.18: FLOW RATE: The rate of flow past the drill bit during this interval.
Column Comment.20: MAXIMUM FORCE ON BIT: Optional field, not on tour sheet, to record maximumweight on bit experienced during the tour.
Column Comment.22: MAXIMUM PENETRATION RATE: the maximum penetration rate of the bit in thisperiod.
Column Comment.23: MAX PENETRATION RATE ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit ofmeasure of the max penetration rate.
Column Comment.24: MAXIMUM ROTARY RPM: Rotations per minute of the drill bit. Usually refers torotary table, but could also refer to top drive, or mud motor rpm (inferred). Unitless.
Column Comment.25: MINIMUM FORCE ON BIT: Optional field, not on tour sheet, to record minimumweight on bit experienced during the tour.
Column Comment.27: MINIMUM PENETRATION RATE: the minimum penetration rate of the bit in thisperiod.
Column Comment.28: MIN PENETRATION RATE ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit ofmeasure of the min penetration rate.
Column Comment.29: MINIMUM ROTARY RPM: Rotations per minute of the drill bit. Usually refers to rotarytable, but could also refer to top drive, or mud motor rpm (inferred). Unitless.
Column Comment.30: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.31: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.32: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.33: TOP DEPTH: the top depth that the bit was drilling at during this interval.
Column Comment.35: TORQUE: Amount of torque required to turn drill string in hole for this bit during thisperiod.
Column Comment.37: TOTAL BIT REVOLUTIONS: Tht total number of revolutions made by the bit duringthis period. Can be calculated.
Column Comment.38: TOTAL DRILLED DISTANCE: Calculated Value Difference between Depth Out andDepth In.
Column Comment.40: TOTAL PERIOD RUN: The total period for which this drill bit was in operation duringthis drilling period, such as 5 hours.
Column Comment.42: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.43: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.44: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.45: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.46: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.47: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.48: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
